args: Yes, I thinkâ€”Look out! Behind you!
It's dangerous here. Please get to safety.
There are a lot more fiends than before.
Yes, but don't let your guard down;\nevery one of these fiends has been\nstrengthened by black mana.
Nnngh... I just had to blow it at the end...\nAll I need to do now is run, but there's no\nway I can with this injury...
Nico, no! Why did you come back?!\nGet to your mother right now!
No! I'm gonna beat up the bad guys\nand save you just like Lady Sheila!
I can't stop the bleeding! We have to\nget them to a healer right now!
I'm not...going to make it...\nPlease, Lady Sheila... My son...
It's okay.\nYou're both going to be fine.
Nico looks up to you so much...\nAnd I, too, was able to change because\nof you... *cough*
I'll carry Ignacio if you carry Nico! Hurry!

My son hasn't regained consciousness.
They're applying healing magic, but his
injuries are... They don't know whether
or not he'll pull through.
I'm so sorry. I should have been\nthere sooner.
No. You are the only reason Nico and I\nare even alive right now.
He fought those fiends because he wanted\nto help those in need just like you do.

He used himself as bait to let us and the
rest of the townspeople who hadn't yet
escaped get away. He said...he said that
was something he could do.
He always was very fainthearted, but he\nwanted to be betterâ€”and it was all\nbecause he met you, Lady Sheila.
Yes. He saw how you'd changed and\nrealized it was possible for him as well.
When I met Lady Sheila again, she didn't\nknow what to do while Nico was crying.
The old Lady Sheila wouldn't have\nhesitated to help. If I'm being frank,\nI thought it was a real shame.
But when she saved us from those fiends,\nI could see she was different. Why, she\ncomforted our boy as if he was her own!
It's incredible that she learned how to\ncomfort a crying child in such a short\nperiod of time!

I always thought heroes were born that
way and remained so throughout their
lives, but now that I've seen Lady Sheila,
I know it's not the case.

Anyone can change, no matter where they
start fromâ€”and change for the better!
And if heroes don't always start as heroes,
that means it's not too late for me.
It was all because of me...
No, my lady! You mistake me!
If I hadn't changed, none of this would\nhave happened and he'd still be alive...
And if this is what change does to people,\nthen I never want to experience it again!
